data.title: Jeff Young - #TheLinkedInGuru
data.meta_description: 𝗣𝗹𝗲𝗮𝘀𝗲 𝗰𝗹𝗶𝗰𝗸 𝗙𝗼𝗹𝗹𝗼𝘄 𝗮𝗯𝗼𝘃𝗲, 𝐫𝐢𝐧𝐠 𝐦𝐲 𝐛𝐞𝐥𝐥, 𝗮𝗻𝗱… · Experience: #TheLinkedInGuru · Education: Please subscribe to my LinkedIn Newsletter #𝐓𝐡𝐞𝐋𝐢𝐧𝐤𝐞𝐝𝐈𝐧𝐆𝐮𝐫𝐮 𝐆𝐚𝐳𝐞𝐭𝐭𝐞 · Location: Columbus, Ohio Metropolitan Area · 500+ connections on LinkedIn. View Jeff Young’s profile on LinkedIn, a professional community of 1 billion members.
data.text:
Social Services

Malka Bendor:

Jeff Young, The LinkedIn Guru has impacted literally hundreds of job seekers ( if not more) who attend his LinkedIn workshops at Jewish Family Services and across Central Ohio. In today's job search world the LinkedIn tool is key to success and Jeff is the master educator, navigating us through what could be a complex, sensitive and overwhelming topic. His teaching style, his subject matter expertise, his patience and ability to hold the attention of an entire room is quite…

Malka Bendor:

Jeff Young, The LinkedIn Guru has impacted literally hundreds of job seekers ( if not more) who attend his LinkedIn workshops at Jewish Family Services and across Central Ohio. In today's job search world the LinkedIn tool is key to success and Jeff is the master educator, navigating us through what could be a complex, sensitive and overwhelming topic. His teaching style, his subject matter expertise, his patience and ability to hold the attention of an entire room is quite amazing. There is always something new to teach as LinkedIn is updated so frequently and Jeff does not let his students and "fan club" miss a beat. He lights up our room on a monthly basis and gives everyone the confidence they need to build a great profile and the tools to keep refining it! I am so grateful and thankful everyday that Jeff is part of the Jewish Family Services "family" of speakers.

Cherrie Durant:

Jeff Young, “The LinkedIn Guru”, has presented multiple times for my Job Seekers here at Jewish Family Services. Each time, Jeff has provided the most up-to-date information regarding the use of LinkedIn. And getting the most of LinkedIn during the job search.

Jeff keeps his audience engaged and his presentation interactive. I highly recommend Jeff Young, “The LinkedIn Guru”, to any audience who wants to maximize their LinkedIn account.

#TheLinkedInGuru I recently reached a milestone of 70 total presentations over the years with Jewish Family Services and Malka Bendor and Elizabeth Enck.

As a thank you for this session Malka put together a word cloud and "slider" of what folks have said about my presentations and my brand on LinkedIn.

A heartfelt thanks to all those that participated and I am saving this honor as a part of my Featured Section!

Since she only included first names, I will not be able to…

#TheLinkedInGuru I recently reached a milestone of 70 total presentations over the years with Jewish Family Services and Malka Bendor and Elizabeth Enck.

As a thank you for this session Malka put together a word cloud and "slider" of what folks have said about my presentations and my brand on LinkedIn.

A heartfelt thanks to all those that participated and I am saving this honor as a part of my Featured Section!

Since she only included first names, I will not be able to determine all the different people that participated so if you were a part of this, please comment so I will be able to thank you individually in the comments!

This is an exciting example of what if feels like to have an outstanding TRIBE (Together Really Is Better for Everyone) on LinkedIn. I am so thankful to know you all and you have all made me feel like I really CAN fly!

https://www.linkedin.com/posts/jeffyoungralemoi_jewish-family-services-70th-seminar-malka-activity-7095438841502707712-f0jr

#TheLinkedInGuru #GuruGoodNews My good news this time is not just for a day, but for years worth of having a wonderful relationship with Malka Bendor and the great folks at Jewish Family Services.

The first time I ever did a free LinkedIn workshop for Jewish Family Services was way back in 2015 and I got to work with such outstanding people like Cherrie Durant, CPRW and Paul R. Newell, MS.ED.

Since then I have done over 60 more workshops and for the last five years I have been…

#TheLinkedInGuru #GuruGoodNews My good news this time is not just for a day, but for years worth of having a wonderful relationship with Malka Bendor and the great folks at Jewish Family Services.

The first time I ever did a free LinkedIn workshop for Jewish Family Services was way back in 2015 and I got to work with such outstanding people like Cherrie Durant, CPRW and Paul R. Newell, MS.ED.

Since then I have done over 60 more workshops and for the last five years I have been doing one a month with my wonderful collaborator teachers Malka Bendor and Elizabeth Enck.

Last night I was honored to be invited to the JFS 2022 Impact Celebration and Annual Meeting.

And, I was even more grateful and honored to be presented with their 2022 Volunteer of the Year award.

A heartfelt thank you to Karen Mozenter and all the staff at JFS for the honor and opportunity to teach and help this fine organization make a difference in the local community and beyond.

And, the "icing on the cake" last night was that I got to get one of those "patented" Malka Bendor hugs and share the evening with her and these great folks in person!

https://www.linkedin.com/posts/jeffyoungralemoi_thelinkedinguru-gurugoodnews-thelinkedinguru-activity-6991351042198188032-pJze

So, this is day #5 of my #SG3, #socialgiving365 experiment here on LinkedIn, I am showcasing three people, every day for the next 365 days, who truly make a difference on LinkedIn and continuously inspire me.

That will be a total of 1095 folks who are AMAZING. I will challenging those people, in turn, to recognize 3 people and so on and so on.....

It is time to blow up LinkedIn with goodness! Here are 3 people who are LinkedIn Powerhouses and just AMAZING people I am so blessed to…

So, this is day #5 of my #SG3, #socialgiving365 experiment here on LinkedIn, I am showcasing three people, every day for the next 365 days, who truly make a difference on LinkedIn and continuously inspire me.

That will be a total of 1095 folks who are AMAZING. I will challenging those people, in turn, to recognize 3 people and so on and so on.....

It is time to blow up LinkedIn with goodness! Here are 3 people who are LinkedIn Powerhouses and just AMAZING people I am so blessed to know. They are all part of the #kindclub.

Jeff Young also known as #thelinkedinguru is a friend, LinkedIn Guru, and fellow t-shirt collector. Jeff spreads LinkedIn goodness around this platform like confetti. If you want to get the latest on tips, and strategies, look no further and sign up for his newsletter, #thelinkedinguru Gazette. Jeff has offered more than 200 free LinkedIn workshops and gets paid 3 via "Cs", Coffee, Conversation, and occasionally Chocolate!

https://www.linkedin.com/newsletters/thelinkedinguru-gazette-6693632635048091649/ (please copy and past to subscribe)!

Today, it's all about #thelinkedinguru; the one & only Jeff Young

The power of LinkedIn is ALL about community & social reciprocity. If it were not for the AMAZING company I keep, I know I wouldn't be hanging out here as much

I HUGE thank you to Jeff Young-not only do we have a great t-shirt collection, we also proudly wear a cape, and both here because we strongly believe in spreading LinkedIn goodness

Almost a year ago (hard to believe), I started the #decidetobekind…

Today, it's all about #thelinkedinguru; the one & only Jeff Young

The power of LinkedIn is ALL about community & social reciprocity. If it were not for the AMAZING company I keep, I know I wouldn't be hanging out here as much

I HUGE thank you to Jeff Young-not only do we have a great t-shirt collection, we also proudly wear a cape, and both here because we strongly believe in spreading LinkedIn goodness

Almost a year ago (hard to believe), I started the #decidetobekind movement on LinkedIn. Over 1000 #decidetobekind wristbands have travelled the world spreading the message that we choose kindness & that bullying does not have a place on LinkedIn; it MUST remain a positive, inspiring, & SAFE space for people to tell their career stories

In the spirit of the #decidetobekind movement & the amazing #kindclub, we have new & quite cool "NO TO BULLYING" t-shirts

Thank you Jeff Young for being you, the brother I never had, & for being in my life ❤️

Don't forget to follow #thelinkedinguru

And, if you want to join the #kindclub & order a funky #decidetobekind wristband (you get one to pay forward), join us:

https://lnkd.in/d5EuRUA

#KindClub LinkedIn Group: https://lnkd.in/eKuv4gr

https://www.linkedin.com/posts/selsliger_thelinkedinguru-decidetobekind-kindclub-activity-6732613396686090240-2AjT

PRESERVATION Today we will be talking about an interesting, phrase "Preservation" the word preservation means so many things to different people, but in this context we will be looking at it from the standpoint of doing the will of the Father. What's Preservation? Preservation can refer to the protection, maintenance, and safeguarding of something, whether it's natural resources, cultural heritage, historical sites, or even digital data. It's about ensuring that these valuable assets remain intact and accessible for future generations. Having Known the definition of preservation, God has called us to be preservers of His creation here on earth, and he wants us to preserve them irrespective of what they do. What are we to preserve according to God standpoint 1. His temple (Your Body):- The body of man or woman should not be exposed to contamination, anything that can corrupt the body is actually what God said we should do away with. "Every sin a man commits is outside the body, except for fornication" God's love is reaching out to you. come to Him 2. Your Talent:- your talent is actually God's grace of enablement for you here on earth. He wants you to preserve your talent, don't sour it. keep learning, keep training, keep spending the midnight candle soon your Talent preserve will bring Gifts and fulfillment to you. 3. Preserve your spouse:- When you marry a woman, you don't just marry her for anything, you get married to her past life, you get married to her excesses, you get married to her pains and weakness, same is still applicable for the male when a woman eventually accepts to get married to a man she marries his past life, pain, excesses, weakness etc Then both parties grow in love by helping each other become better This is all I want you to know about PERSEVERATION ~ There's so much Truth our generation needs to return to because truth is absolute no matter where you take it to. #Oluwasholalife'sbranding #Linkedlntruththeraphy #RemedialHub #HealingSchool Babatunde Shola

KARMIC STREAM #poem Ripples along a lazy stream of time crossing whirlwind space. Rippling into etched contours, teasing tricks of mind. Expecting miracles. One day precedes the next. Reflective pooling, a faultless, serene slip of spring. Next I know I am hauling logs through winter cold, ice-tinged hands and toes dripping nose, exhausted, wilting. Life brings no promises. None to hold them to. There are no changelings of the night; not even prescient aliens to awe us. There is energy. There is form. There is shadow bleeding into substance. There is here and now receding into there and then. There are the promises we keep never knowing we have made them. Ripples shining in the sun colours of a thousand worlds’ rainbows. Ripples quietly expressing, infinitely regressing, first cause last effect.

Game on! Get your thoughts together and get your comments ready. The DEA published the NPRM (document attached) on May 16th; TODAY is the official start of the 60-day comment period. This is a 92-page document; you can read it all or just get to the meat of what the DEA is proposing; go to the last two pages and the last two paragraphs in this document to read it. Trust me when I say all the multi-state operators have their cannabis lawyers clicking away at their keyboards to submit comments. All the big players that are not in cannabis currently because of its Schedule 1 designation are preparing their comments. Who will speak for us, the smaller companies, the women-owned companies, BIPOC-owned companies, the formerly incarcerated-owned companies, and veteran-owned companies? We are, we all are. We are going to speak for ourselves and en masse. Now is the time to have our voices heard, ensure our priorities are considered, and solidify that our businesses, employees, and communities benefit from this rescheduling. The People's Ecosystem is putting together a working group led by Kate Stevens and Frederika M. Easley to help build comments for our company and assist interested external stakeholders, big or small, in creating their own comments. This working group is not to judge or influence what you or your company want to comment on; it is to help build the most powerful, succinct, and impactful comments to help shape the future of our industry. If you are interested in joining our working group you can sign up here: https://lnkd.in/dBc84HSp Let's do this! #thepeoplesecosystem #cannabis #cannabisculture #cannabiscommunity #cannabisindustry #dea #rescheduling #thepeopleareblunt https://lnkd.in/dBc84HSp

Are you Living in Fear as a Domestic Violence Victim? You Don't Have to. Is fear the air you breathe in your relationship? Do you constantly walk on eggshells, afraid of setting your partner off? You're not alone. Fear is a powerful weapon wielded by abusers in domestic violence and narcissistic relationships. Why Abusers Use Fear: 💜 Control: Fear keeps you isolated and afraid to speak up or leave. 💜 They use threats and intimidation to get what they want. 💜 Silence: They silence your voice and gaslight you into questioning your reality. Does this sound familiar? ➡ Maybe you avoid certain topics or activities because you know it'll upset them. ➡ constantly apologize, even when you haven't done anything wrong. ➡ feel like you're constantly "walking on eggshells." How to Break Free from the Grip of Fear : 🦋 Acknowledge Your Fear: It's normal to be afraid in scary situations. This is your body's natural response to indicate you're not in a safe space. 🦋 Identify the Abuse: Educate yourself about the signs of domestic violence and narcissistic abuse. 🦋 Build Your Support System: Reach out to trusted friends, family, domestic violence advocate, therapist or domestic violence hotline. You ARE NOT alone! 🦋 Safety Plan: Create a well thought out safety plan for escape, including a safe place to go, trusted contacts, and important documents, medications etc. Empowering Yourself: ⭐️ Focus on Your Strengths: Remember your worth! Make a list of your strengths and accomplishments to remind you of who you are. ⭐️ Practice Self-Care: Take care of yourself physically and emotionally. Eat healthy, get enough sleep, and find healthy ways to manage stress. ‍ ⭐️ Believe in Yourself: You have the strength to break free! Don't let fear hold you back. You deserve to live a life free from fear! Are you ready to discover your true power and rebuild your life on your terms? Reach out to us today for personalized support, through domestic violence (abuse) empowerment life coaching. @Risingbeyondabuse, we believe that no one should face their challenges alone. Together, we can rise above abuse! P.S: If you or someone you know is experiencing abuse, reach out for help today. If you find this post helpful maybe someone else will too ~ please share this post ~ together we can make a difference! Do you find this post useful? Don't forget to: 🦋 Repost/Share this post with someone who needs to hear it 👍 Hit the notification 🔔 + Follow Theresa Marie Villanova 🦋 #NoMoreFear #DomesticViolenceSurvivor #EmpoweredYou

Daily Horoscope: Moon Transiting Scorpio, May 21, 2024 Moon transiting Scorpio, Tuesday, May 21st, delivers the task of separating the truth from fiction as the moon in an investigative water sign forms a T-square aspect pattern with Mercury in Taurus, and Pluto in Aquarius, as well as a trine aspect with Saturn in Pisces. Hopefully, the influence of Saturn - a planet of authority, responsibility, and integrity, and wisdom - in a sign associated with compassion and tolerance, will give you (and others) pause for thought before speaking, because the T-square can definitely complicate the consequences of idle or malicious gossip. Mars, Chiron and the North Node in Aries, opposing the South Node in Libra, reminds you to "Do unto others, as you would have them do unto you.", and if you forget to follow this Golden Rule, you will accrue karmic lessons. The T-square brings shadowy things to light today, which may increase your awareness of people's true character and motivations. If someone says something hurtful, but later tells you they didn't mean it, they probably did mean it - but Neptune in Pisces engaging in a Minor Grand Trine with Uranus, Venus, Jupiter in Taurus, the sun in Gemini, and Pluto retrograde in Aquarius inclines you to bestow a second chance in the belief that people can, and sometimes do, change. The best way to protect yourself from being the subject of discussion now is to insert yourself in the group. #astrology #horoscope #moontransit

Choose Your Foundation Imagine standing next to the sea as waves crash at your feet, storm clouds swallow the sky, and the wind whips your face. You know you need shelter—and that’s when you see a small hut nestled in the sand nearby, and one further away that’s firmly built into a rocky hill. Which shelter would you choose to take cover in? 2,000 years ago, when Jesus walked this earth, He often told stories to the crowds that gathered around to hear Him teach. One day, He said to them: “Anyone who listens to my teaching and follows it is wise, like a person who builds a house on solid rock. Though the rain comes in torrents and the floodwaters rise and the winds beat against that house, it won’t collapse because it is built on bedrock.” ‭‭ Matthew‬ ‭7:24-25‬ ‭NLT‬‬ As was His way, Jesus used real-life examples to help explain spiritual truths: “But anyone who hears my teaching and doesn’t obey it is foolish, like a person who builds a house on sand. When the rains and floods come and the winds beat against that house, it will collapse with a mighty crash.” ‭‭Matthew‬ ‭7:26-27‬ ‭NLT‬‬ We are all building our lives on something. Every decision we make reinforces what we believe our support system to be. So when life’s storms come, will the thing you’ve built your life on support you—or cause you to crumble? Jesus’ teachings have remained reliable and steadfast through social upheaval, the rise and fall of government regimes, and generations of historic change. No matter what has happened—God’s Word still stands firm. Teachings from the world, on the other hand, tend to shift with each generation. Like shifting sand, what current culture provides is usually unstable because its values are constantly changing. Storms are inevitable and challenges will come, but you get to choose your foundation. You can choose to make Jesus the one thing you build your life upon, or you can choose whatever habit, idea, or desire feels good and accessible in the moment. Today, what will you build your life upon?
